pullRequest.title: Configure identity provider for a components through the Data View
pullRequest.bodyText:
Custom identity provider now could be set globally through DataView interface and this also will affect the components.
See components PRs:

vaadin/vaadin-select-flow#82
vaadin/vaadin-checkbox-flow#155
vaadin/vaadin-grid-flow#1044

commit.message: Configure identity provider for a components through the Data View

nodes.bodyText: You cannot presume this, as it is IMO fine that the user adds the size change listener via the data view before setting the data provider #8583

There is a chance that

the user stores the data view and reuses
the user changes the data provider manually and still uses the correct type of data for the data view
the identity method points to the old data provider getId method.
Wouldn't it be fine to only store a customized one ?
We can't store things in the data view as those are disposable ... you should store this into the component instance using ComponentUtil:setData

"provided by {@link DataProvider#getId(Object)}."
What does this mean when the users should not care about data providers anymore ?
Since the default implementation for getId requires equals, you should say it, so please change to say something like "by default equals method is used for identity check but if a custom data provider is used, then the getId method is used instead."

commit.message: Store identity provider in a component

nodes.bodyText:
just use "items" not "data items"
not stored in data provider, but fetched by it
should not refer to data provider
So maybe something like
"A callback interface that is used to provide the identifier of an item."
And thus I would consider renaming this to IdentifierProvider instead since it seems to be more accurate term instead of "identity" which is kind of OK
